revised_title: On the Hardness of Shells and the Diet of the Soal-Fish
tldr: The author, Peter Collinson, discusses the remarkable hardness and durability of shells and their presence in the diet of the soal-fish. He observes that despite being exposed to harsh conditions, shells remain intact and uncorrupted. He also notes that the soal-fish, which feeds on shellfish, is able to digest them without the need for a strong jaw or teeth, suggesting that it may use a special solvent to break down the shells.
